Title:
New evidences strongly point to sciaenids origin in the New
world that occurred during late Jurassic to early Cretaceous
Keywords:
Sciaenidae; phylogeny; divergence time; origin;
evolution
Abstract:
Background Sciaenids are widely distributed throughout the
coastal waters and estuaries, 23 genera of this family are endemic to
the Old world. Evolutionary relationships among Old world sciaenids and
origin have remained unresolved despite their diversity and importance.
Previous investigations of sciaenids phylogeny, based primarily on
morphological data or molecular data, have been unsuccessful at
elucidating these relationships. Besides, hypotheses that explain the
origin and biogeography distribution of sciaenids are controversial, and
the evolutionary scenario for this group was unclear.
